snippet: The legacy of King Norodom Sihanouk, who died Monday in Beijing at age 89, might be forever sealed and tarnished by his alliance with the hyper-communist Khmer Rouge movement that ravaged Cambodia from 1975 to 1979.
abstract: The legacy of King Norodom Sihanouk, who died Monday in Beijing at age 89, might be forever sealed and tarnished by his alliance with the hyper-communist Khmer Rouge movement that ravaged Cambodia from 1975 to 1979.

headline.main: The Bloodied Legacy of Cambodia's Chameleon King

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
